title: The Cathedral Builders
description: A quick, practical guide to The Cathedral Builders.

hook.text: Medieval cathedrals took longer to build than most modern skyscrapersâ€”some spanned 200 years.

buildup.text: Entire towns donated labor and money. Building a cathedral was a community project spanning generations.

discovery.text: Gothic flying buttresses let builders push walls higher and add massive stained glass windows.

twist.text: Some collapsed during construction. Beauvais Cathedral's choir vault fell twiceâ€”ambition exceeded physics.

climax.text: These buildings still stand. Notre-Dame, Chartres, and Cologne outlasted the kingdoms that built them.

punchline.text: They built for eternity and mostly succeeded.

quiz.question: What engineering innovation allowed Gothic cathedrals to reach new heights?
options: Flying buttresses that supported thinner walls
